revision.text:
Best Practice[[File:HintIcon.png|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=]]
üëç #{{{1|}}} {{{2|}}}
Inserts a block with the best practice description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{BestPractice
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the heading text (goes right after the thumb-up icon)
|2      = The second unnamed parameter contains the best practice description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the best practice block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the best practice badge. Defaults to "bg-warning".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the best practice badge label. Defaults to "bg-info".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

{{#if: {{{header|}}} |
{{{header|The Cell}}}
}}{{#if: {{{image|}}} |
[[File:{{PAGENAME:{{{image|}}}}}|class=w-100 h-auto|link={{{ilink|}}}]]
}}{{#if: {{{preface|}}}{{{title|}}}{{{content|}}} |
{{#if: {{{preface|}}} |
{{{preface|}}}
}}{{#if: {{{title|}}} |
{{{title|}}}
}}
{{{content|}}}
}}{{#if: {{{footer|}}} |
{{{footer|}}}
}} 
{{Card
|header  = 
|hclasses= # CSS class names for the header
|image   =
|ilink   = # image click target
|ihalf   = # limit the image height [ Y|y|Yes|yes|True|true|1 ]
|preface =
|title   = # CSS class names for the title
|tclasses=
|content =
|footer  =
|fclasses= # CSS class names for the footer
|classes = # CSS class names for the card
}}
== Elementary Cards == {{Card |header = Header |hclasses= |image = |preface = Preface text |title = Title |content = Content: Please note that all contributions to The Cell may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors. If you do not want your writing to be edited mercilessly, then do not submit it here. |footer = Footer |classes = }} {{Card |header = Header |image = |preface = Preface text |title = Title |content = Content: Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors. If you do not want your writing to be edited mercilessly, then do not submit it here. |footer = Footer |classes = bg-light }} {{MerlinVideoPlayer |videoID=sEb5M2zyCxQ02de00E4bYrotYH3dsd016u01DlBYQw00hOfo |videoTitle=Interpreting nubers based on their position }} {{Card |header = |image = MerlinAtDesk.jpg |ilink = Special:Preferences |ihalf = 1 |preface = Preface text |title = Title |content = Content: Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors. If you do not want your writing to be edited mercilessly, then do not submit it here. |footer = }} == Card Deck == For a wall of cards wrap some of them into
...
.
{{Card |header = Header |hclasses= bg-dark |image = |preface = Preface text |title = Title |content = Content: Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors. If you do not want your writing to be edited mercilessly, then do not submit it here. |footer = Footer |fclasses= bg-dark |classes = bg-dark text-white }} {{Card |header = Header |hclasses= bg-primary text-white |image = |preface = Preface text |title = Title |content = Content: Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors. If you do not want your writing to be edited mercilessly, then do not submit it here. |footer = Footer |classes = bg-light }} {{Card |header = |image = MerlinAtDesk.jpg |ilink = Special:Preferences |preface = Preface text |title = Title |content = Content: Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors. If you do not want your writing to be edited mercilessly, then do not submit it here. |footer = Footer }}

Caution[[File:WarnIcon.png|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=]]
{{{1|}}}
Inserts a block with the caution description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{Caution
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the caution description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the caution block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the caution badge. Defaults to "alert-danger".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the caution badge label. Defaults to "badge-danger".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

Coming Soon[[File:ComingSoonIcon.png|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=]]
{{{1|}}}
Inserts a block with the upcoming event description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{ComingSoon
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the upcoming event description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the upcoming event block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the upcoming event badge. Defaults to "bg-dark".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the upcoming event badge label. Defaults to "badge-dark".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

== Purpose == Mimics console input / output. == Implementation approach == The template is targeted to merge functionality of [[Template:ConsoleLine]] and [[Template:ConsoleLines]]. The template allows the injection of [[Help:Bootstrap classes|bootstrap classes]], primarily to add rounded corners and some padding to the single template instance or to the first and last instances of the template call series. Editors are encouraged to replace / edit all instances of both templates eventually using the proposed syntax / parameters. == Usage == The first unnamed parameter contains the console input/output and it is the only mandatory parameter. There are the optional named parameters: 
prompt   # The console prompt.
classes  # Names of CSS classes which apply to the block.
;Example 
{{ConsoleLines
|classes=rounded py-2
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
;Result {{ConsoleLines |classes=rounded py-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} {{hint|class=mt-4| # Use one template for a single command prompt. # Use rounded py-2 classes to add border radius and some vertical padding. # Do not use
to insert a line break, just start typing on the new line. # Use a number of subsequent instances of the template to build a block of console lines with multiple command prompts. In this case you might want: #* to add rounded corners only to the top of the first instance and to the bottom of the last instance #* not to use padding between console lines blocks. # Play with rounded-top, rounded-bottom, pt-2, pb-2 to achieve the desired layout. # In complex cases when the console output fails to appear correctly (for example, when it contains the reserved characrters like =), wrap it into tag. }} ;Example 
{{ConsoleLines
|classes=rounded-top pt-2 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
{{ConsoleLines
|classes= 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|ping 8.8.8.8
PING 8.8.8.8 (8.8.8.8) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=1 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=2 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=3 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=4 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms
^C
--- 8.8.8.8 ping statistics ---
4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3004ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 19.453/19.573/19.671/0.091 ms
}}
{{ConsoleLines
|classes=rounded-bottom pb-2 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
;Result {{ConsoleLines |classes=rounded-top pt-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} {{ConsoleLines |classes= |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |ping 8.8.8.8 PING 8.8.8.8 (8.8.8.8) 56(84) bytes of data. 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=1 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=2 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=3 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=4 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms ^C --- 8.8.8.8 ping statistics --- 4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3004ms rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 19.453/19.573/19.671/0.091 ms }} {{ConsoleLines |classes=rounded-bottom pb-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} == Variations == There are two additional colour flavours of this template: * [[Template:ConsoleLinesLight]] and * [[Template:ConsoleLinesDark]] ; Light {{ConsoleLinesLight |classes=rounded py-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} ; Dark {{ConsoleLinesDark |classes=rounded py-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }}
{{#tag:poem|{{#if: {{{prompt|}}}|{{{prompt|}}} }}{{{1|}}}|compact}}

== Usage == The first unnamed parameter contains the console input/output and it is the only mandatory parameter. There are the optional named parameters: 
prompt   # The console prompt.
classes  # Names of CSS classes which apply to the block.
;Example 
{{ConsoleLinesLight
|classes=rounded py-2
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
;Result {{ConsoleLinesLight |classes=rounded py-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} {{hint|class=mt-4| # Use one template for a single command prompt. # Use rounded py-2 classes to add border radius and some vertical padding. # Do not use
to insert a line break, just start typing on the new line. # Use a number of subsequent instances of the template to build a block of console lines with multiple command prompts. In this case you might want: #* to add rounded corners only to the top of the first instance and to the bottom of the last instance #* not to use padding between console lines blocks. # Play with rounded-top, rounded-bottom, pt-2, pb-2 to achieve the desired layout. See [{{fullurl: Merlin_Maven_Engagement|type=revision&diff=17101&oldid=12145}} how to port existing templates]. # In complex cases when the console output fails to appear correctly (for example, when it contains the reserved characrters like =), wrap it into tag. }} ;Example 
{{ConsoleLinesLight
|classes=rounded-top pt-2 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
{{ConsoleLinesLight
|classes= 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|ping 8.8.8.8
PING 8.8.8.8 (8.8.8.8) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=1 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=2 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=3 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=4 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms
^C
--- 8.8.8.8 ping statistics ---
4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3004ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 19.453/19.573/19.671/0.091 ms
}}
{{ConsoleLinesLight
|classes=rounded-bottom pb-2 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
;Result {{ConsoleLinesLight |classes=rounded-top pt-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} {{ConsoleLinesLight |classes= |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |ping 8.8.8.8 PING 8.8.8.8 (8.8.8.8) 56(84) bytes of data. 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=1 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=2 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=3 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=4 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms ^C --- 8.8.8.8 ping statistics --- 4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3004ms rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 19.453/19.573/19.671/0.091 ms }} {{ConsoleLinesLight |classes=rounded-bottom pb-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }}
{{#tag:poem|{{#if: {{{prompt|}}}|{{{prompt|}}} }}{{{1|}}}|compact}}

revision.text:
== Usage == The first unnamed parameter contains the console input/output and it is the only mandatory parameter. There are the optional named parameters: 
prompt   # The console prompt.
classes  # Names of CSS classes which apply to the block.
;Example 
{{ConsoleLines
|classes=rounded py-2
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
;Result {{ConsoleLines |classes=rounded py-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} {{hint|class=mt-4| # Use one template for a single command prompt. # Use rounded py-2 classes to add border radius and some vertical padding. # Do not use
to insert a line break, just start typing on the new line. # Use a number of subsequent instances of the template to build a block of console lines with multiple command prompts. In this case you might want: #* to add rounded corners only to the top of the first instance and to the bottom of the last instance #* not to use padding between console lines blocks. # Play with rounded-top, rounded-bottom, pt-2, pb-2 to achieve the desired layout. See [{{fullurl: Merlin_Maven_Engagement|type=revision&diff=17101&oldid=12145}} how to port existing templates]. # In complex cases when the console output fails to appear correctly (for example, when it contains the reserved characrters like =), wrap it into tag. }} ;Example 
{{ConsoleLines
|classes=rounded-top pt-2 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
{{ConsoleLines
|classes= 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|ping 8.8.8.8
PING 8.8.8.8 (8.8.8.8) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=1 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=2 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=3 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms
64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=4 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms
^C
--- 8.8.8.8 ping statistics ---
4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3004ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 19.453/19.573/19.671/0.091 ms
}}
{{ConsoleLines
|classes=rounded-bottom pb-2 
|prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$
|sudo systemctl status apache2
[sudo] password for john-williams:           
Unit apache2.service could not be found.
}}
;Result {{ConsoleLines |classes=rounded-top pt-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }} {{ConsoleLines |classes= |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |ping 8.8.8.8 PING 8.8.8.8 (8.8.8.8) 56(84) bytes of data. 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=1 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=2 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=3 ttl=116 time=19.7 ms 64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: icmp_seq=4 ttl=116 time=19.5 ms ^C --- 8.8.8.8 ping statistics --- 4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3004ms rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 19.453/19.573/19.671/0.091 ms }} {{ConsoleLines |classes=rounded-bottom pb-2 |prompt=john-williams@codermerlin:~$ |sudo systemctl status apache2 [sudo] password for john-williams: Unit apache2.service could not be found. }}

Excursions[[File:101 138 Boeheimkirchen 070430.jpg|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=|150px]]
{{{1|}}}
Inserts a block with the excursion description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{Excursion
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the excursion description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the excursion block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the excursion badge. Defaults to "bg-info".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the excursion badge label. Defaults to "badge-warning".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

Exercises[[File:ExercisesIcon.png|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=]]
{{{1|}}}
Inserts a block with the exercises description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{Exercises
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the exercises description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the exercises block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the exercises badge. Defaults to "alert-success".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the exercises badge label. Defaults to "badge-success".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

Going Deeper[[File:GoingDeeperIcon.png|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=]]
{{{1|}}}
Inserts a block with the detailed knowledge description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{GoingDeeper
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the detailed knowledge description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the detailed knowledge block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the detailed knowledge badge. Defaults to "bg-primary".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the detailed knowledge badge label. Defaults to "badge-dark".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

Observe[[File:ObserveIcon.png|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=]]
Observe, Ponder, and Journal: {{{1|}}} {{{2|}}}
Inserts a block with the detailed knowledge description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{Observe
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the detailed knowledge heading
|2      = The second unnamed parameter contains the detailed knowledge description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the detailed knowledge block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the detailed knowledge badge. Defaults to "alert-primary".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the detailed knowledge badge label. Defaults to "badge-primary".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

Question[[File:Question Mark Icon - Blue Box.svg|class=m-auto d-none d-md-inline-block|link=]]
{{{1|}}}
Inserts a block with the question description. ;Syntax {{ConsoleLinesLight|
{{Question
|1      = The first unnamed parameter contains the detailed knowledge description
|class  = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the question block. Is empty by default.
|bclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the question badge. Defaults to "alert-info".
|lclass = Contains names of bootstrap classes to paint the question badge label. Defaults to "badge-info".
}}
|classes=rounded}}

{{card |footer={{{1|This is a site notice }}} |fclasses=alert alert-{{{2|primary}}} font-weight-bold mb-0 justify-content-center flex-column flex-md-row rounded |classes=w-100 p-1 sitenotice-alert plainlinks border-0 {{{3|}}} }} ;Code 
{{Sitenotice
|             # Your message goes here ...
|             # Bootstrap coloring classes names [ info, secondary, warning, success, etc ]
}}
;Example 
{{Sitenotice}}
;Result {{Sitenotice}} ;Example 
{{Sitenotice|The wiki is under maintenance. Keep quiet.|info|fa-2x}}
;Result {{Sitenotice|The wiki is under maintenance. Keep quiet.|info|fa-2x}} ;Example 
{{Sitenotice|Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors.|warning}}
;Result {{Sitenotice|Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} may be edited, altered, or removed by other contributors.|warning}}

== General approach == # Avoid excessive styling. Most of text and page elements go with nice default formatting. Look at [[project:Bootstrap|examples]]. # Avoid using inline styling (eg. style="border: 1px solid lightgray"). # Try to keep to the built-in Bootstrap classes. # Classes may be hardcoded in the template for easy usage and unified look of the elements. # Classes may be passed to the template as parameters for easy ustomization of element instances. # Custom classes can be defined on [[Mediawiki:Common.css]]. Many templates provide class ({prefix}class) or classes ({prefix}classes) parameters mostly to position and to paint content elements. In theory, parameters can accept any of [https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.1/getting-started/introduction/ bootstrap] or [[Mediawiki:Common.css|custom]] CSS classes names. In this guidance we'll mention some starightforward and useful classes only. == Templates == Read more about how to use some important templates: * [[Template:BestPractice‚Äé]] * [[Template:Card]] * [[Template:Caution‚Äé‚Äé]] * [[Template:ComingSoon‚Äé]] * [[Template:ConsoleLines]] ** [[Template:ConsoleLinesLight]] ** [[Template:ConsoleLinesDark]] * [[Template:Excursion‚Äé]] * [[Template:Exercises‚Äé‚Äé]] * [[Template:GoingDeeper‚Äé]] * [[Template:Observe‚Äé]] * [[Template:Question]] * [[Template:Sitenotice]] == Margin and padding == This group of classes allows define the outer and the inner spacing of the element. There are prefixes that allow to explain to the browser what space is to be modified: * m- - margin * p- - padding * my- - vertical margin * py- - vertical padding * mx- - horizontal margin * px- - horizontal padding * mt- - top margin * mb- - bottom margin * ml- - left margin * mr- - right margin * pt- - top padding * pb- - bottom padding * pl- - left padding * pr- - right padding There is a scale of shortcuts to define the amount of space to be added: * 5 - 3rem * 4 - 1.5rem * 3 - 1rem * 2 - 0.5rem * 1 - 0.25rem * 0 - 0 Margins can be negative: * n1 - (-0.25rem) * n2 - (-0.5rem) * n3 - (-1rem) * n4 - (-1.5rem) * n5 - (-3rem) There is an auto shortcut that sets the correspondent dimension value to "auto". === Examples === 
{{BSExample
|outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block
|inner-classes=m-4 d-inline-block
|inner-content=This adds 1.5rem outer space for the inner white div on all sides
}}
{{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block |inner-classes=bg-white m-4 |inner-content=This adds 1.5rem outer space for the inner div on all sides }} 
{{BSExample
|outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block
|inner-classes=bg-white my-3 mr-2
|inner-content=This adds 1rem vertical outer space and 0.5rem right outer space for the inner div
}}
{{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block |inner-classes=bg-white my-3 mr-2 |inner-content=This adds 1rem vertical outer space and 0.5rem right outer space for the inner div }} 
{{BSExample
|outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block
|inner-classes=bg-white my-3 mr-2 p-2
|inner-content=This adds 1rem vertical outer space and 0.5rem right outer space for the inner div + 0.5rem inner space (padding)
}}
{{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block |inner-classes=bg-white my-3 mr-2 p-2 |inner-content=This adds 1rem vertical outer space and 0.5rem right outer space for the inner div + 0.5rem inner space (padding) }} 
{{BSExample
|outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block p-3
|inner-classes=bg-white p-3
|inner-content=This adds 1rem padding to the outer and inner divs
}}
{{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block p-3 |inner-classes=bg-white p-3 |inner-content=This adds 1rem padding to the outer and inner divs }} 
{{BSExample
|outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block p-3 ml-n4
|inner-classes=bg-white p-3
|inner-content=This adds 1rem padding to the outer and inner divs and adds the negative 1.5rem margin on the left
}}
{{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-success d-inline-block p-3 ml-n4 |inner-classes=bg-white p-3 |inner-content=This adds 1rem padding to the outer and inner divs and adds the negative 1.5rem margin on the left }} 
{{BSExample
|outer-classes=bg-success d-flex w-100
|inner-classes=bg-white p-3 mx-auto my-3
|inner-content=This adds 1rem vertical margin and automatic horizontal margin to the inner div
}}
{{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-success d-flex w-100 |inner-classes=bg-white p-3 mx-auto my-3 |inner-content=This adds 1rem vertical margin and automatic horizontal margin to the inner div }} == Background, Foreground, Border Colors == Use prefixes: * bg- to define the background color * text- to define the foreground color * border- to define the border color Use color codes to paint the text or the background: * primary * secondary * success * danger * info * warning * dark * light * white === Examples === {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-primary d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-dark text-light p-3 mx-auto my-3 |inner-content=Outer = bg-primary; Inner = bg-dark text-light }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-light d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-warning text-danger p-3 mx-auto my-3 |inner-content=Outer = bg-light; Inner = bg-white text-danger }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-warning border border-danger d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-light text-muted p-3 mx-auto my-3 |inner-content=Outer = bg-warning border border-danger; Inner = bg-light text-muted }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-secondary d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-info text-white p-3 mx-auto my-3 |inner-content=Outer = bg-secondary; Inner = bg-info text-white }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-white border border-dark d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-success text-white border-info p-3 mx-auto my-3 |inner-content=Outer = bg-white border border-dark; Inner = bg-success text-white }} === Hints === Please, note in the above examples: * To use border color class, the border class must be added. * There is the muted color shortcut available for the text (foreground) color. * Play combining the classes nicely. == Border Radius == Use the following classes to add the standard border radius: * rounded * rounded-top * rounded-bottom * rounded-left * rounded-right * rounded-circle {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-warning border border-danger d-flex w-100 mb-2 rounded-top |inner-classes=bg-light text-dark border border-danger p-3 mx-auto my-3 rounded-circle |inner-content=Outer = rounded-top; Inner = rounded-circle }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-primary d-flex w-100 mb-2 rounded |inner-classes=bg-dark text-light p-3 mx-auto my-3 rounded-bottom |inner-content=Outer = rounded; Inner = rounded-bottom }} === Hints === As you may guess rounded-0 removes border-radius, if any. == Shadows == Add shadows to your elements using classes: * shadow-sm * shadow * shadow-lg {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-white d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-light border p-3 mx-auto my-3 shadow-sm |inner-content=Inner = shadow-sm }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-white d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-light border p-3 mx-auto my-3 shadow |inner-content=Inner = shadow }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=bg-white d-flex w-100 mb-2 |inner-classes=bg-light border p-3 mx-auto my-3 shadow-lg |inner-content=Inner = shadow-lg }} == Display == The most useful display classes are: * d-block - makes the element act as a block container * d-inline-block - makes the element act as an inline block container * d-flex - makes the element act as a flexbox container * d-none - makes the element disappear == Text Alignment or Flex Elements Distribution == It is self-explanatory: * text-left * text-center * text-right When using flexbox (d-flex), inner (child) elements can be aligned using classes: * justify-content-between * justify-content-evenly * justify-content-start * justify-content-end * align-items-start * align-items-end * align-items-center You can play with flex direction: * flex-column * flex-column-reverse * flex-row * flex-row-reverse === Examples === {{BSExample |outer-classes=p-2 bg-light mb-2 |inner-classes=d-flex justify-content-evenly |inner-content=We use d-flex justify-content-evenly }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=p-2 bg-light mb-2 |inner-classes=d-flex justify-content-between |inner-content=We use d-flex justify-content-between }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=p-2 bg-light mb-2 |inner-classes=d-flex flex-column |inner-content=We use d-flex flex-column }} {{BSExample |outer-classes=p-2 bg-light mb-2 |inner-classes=d-flex flex-column align-items-center flex-column-reverse |inner-content=We use d-flex align-items-center flex-column-reverse }} == Breakpoints == There are suffixes to apply the class definition to the given screen size: * -xs- - extra small, 0px and up * -sm- - small, 576px and up * -md- - medium, 768 and up * -lg- - large, 992px and up * -cmln- - "chameleon", 1105px and up * -xl- - extra large, 1900px and up === Examples === * d-none d-lg-block - displays element on large screens * mx-3 mx-cmln-auto - adds auto horizontal margins (centers the element across its parent) at 1105px and up, while keeping the horizontal margin equal to 1rem on smaller viewports * flex-column flex-md-row - stack elements on small screens, otherwise keeping them in a row

Hello, world!

This is a simple hero unit, a simple jumbotron-style component for calling extra attention to featured content or information.

It uses utility classes for typography and spacing to space content out within the larger container.
